data.name: icosi-do Demo
data.detailed_description:
This is a demo version of icosi-do, a single-player minimalist puzzle game that is as much a game of logic as it is of patience. The objective of each puzzle is to swap pairs of colored rods such that all four rods that meet in any of 30 corners have different colors - a problem known as "edge coloring" in mathematics. The catch is to solve each puzzle with a limited number of swaps (unless you deactivate that limit).

The demo offers thousands of procedurally generated puzzles in 7 difficulty levels using four modes (with and without limited number of swaps; with the different kinds of rods visualized as colors or as rotations). The puzzles in this demo are not very difficult, but you will experience glimpses of what makes the puzzles in the higher difficulty levels of the full game so challenging.

Inspired by a fictional game of a popular sci-fi TV series, the puzzle design combines a mathematical problem (edge coloring an icosidodecahedral graph) with a comfortable learning curve and an extra challenging mode for the most devoted fans.

Other Features

  • The game may be played with keyboard, two-button mouse, Xbox controller, or any combination of them.
  • Settings are provided to customize sensitivity and rotation directions of controls, as well as many other aspects of the game.
  • The innovative game menu might require some getting used to, but it is a visual treat to see how all text is formed by the same 60 swirling rods that also form the puzzles.
  • Each puzzle is represented by a 6-digit code such that it is easy to replay and share any puzzle.
  • The background music consists of procedurally modified versions of the Prelude in C major by Johann Sebastian Bach in dozens of variations - from dreamily slow piano to blazingly fast guitar.

Coming Soon!

The current plan is to present this demo at October's Steam Next Fest and then publish the game in November 2022. Please wishlist the game to receive a reminder when it is published - and to help promoting the game on Steam!

data.short_description: Your superpower is your patience. Nurture it with this demo of a single-player minimalist puzzle based on pure logic: swap pairs of colored rods such that all four rods that meet in any of 30 corners have different colors. Thousands of problems await you: from trivial to superhuman difficult.
